title: Frederick Law Olmsted National Historic Site: Teens
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Kids & Youth     Teens               Teens          Are you a high school student? Love visual art or creative writing? Help us celebrate the National Park Service Centennial! "Inspired by Olmsted" asks high school students to reflect on the mission statement of the National Park Service, authored by Frederick Law Olmsted, Jr. You could win a cash prize and the opportunity to have your work displayed at Frederick Law Olmsted National Historic Site for the 100th birthday of the National Park Service in August 2016! Click here to learn more.             Teen employment with the National Park Service!  Get paid to work at a National Historic Site from July- August 2016. APPLY NOW!      Working at a historic site has a lot of benefits, including being paid! Depending on the position you apply for your work can range from maintaining historical grounds and facilities, to interacting with local to international people, to developing ways to engage your peers in the National Park Service. These positions are open to teens, ages 15-18. To learn more about employment opportunities follow the link to our detailed webpage.
